column4: Hello! I'm trying to run Ubuntu Customization Kit to build a customized Ubuntu (i.e. only with the apps/features I want) using the Ubuntu Mini remix as the 'source'. I'm having some troubles though...is anyone willing to take a bit and see if they can help me out? (warning: I'm an Ubuntu newbie)
Has anyone here used Ubuntu Customization Kit before?
it's really specific, I'm stuck at this one point using UCK...it gives me three options, 1) select a package manager, 2) console something, etc.
when I select option 1, it says there's no package manager installed...
ok so what's your problem? more details are required on what you actually need help with
also see the links that ubottu posted

now that I read that link on remastering, I think it might not be quite what I want - because I don't have a concrete list of all the apps I want to add/remove - basically, what I'm looking for is a super 'slim' version of Ubuntu that just has the bare minimum of apps, so that I can then go on to add apps on an as needed basis
ahh! let me check that out :)
it's already been done numerous times so I wouldn't suggest doing something that has already been done, unless you really need too
yeah, I see what you mean.
you can still use the minimal setup as a base, install packages and then re-create your own flavour of ubuntu
sweet, I think this is exactly what I was looking for
also this link for the download https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/MinimalCD
Nice, thanks a lot for this suggestion!
